documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: httpd24 bug fix and enhancement update

note.text: Updated httpd24 packages are now available as a part of Red Hat Software Collections for Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The Apache HTTP Server is a powerful, efficient, and extensible web server. The httpd24 packages provide a recent stable release of version 2.4 of the Apache HTTP Server, along with the mod_auth_kerb module.

The httpd24 packages have been updated with Red Hat Software Collections 3.6. 

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Software Collections 3.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.
note.title: Details

note.title: Terms of Use

documentdistribution.text: Copyright Â© 2023 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

note.text: A flaw was found in Apache httpd in versions 2.4.32 to 2.4.46. The uwsgi protocol does not serialize more than 16K of HTTP header leading to resource exhaustion and denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1866563: CVE-2020-11984 httpd: mod_proxy_uwsgi buffer overflow

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Apache project for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in Apache httpd in versions 2.4.20 to 2.4.43. Logging using the wrong pool by mod_http2 at debug/trace log level may lead to potential crashes and denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1866564: CVE-2020-11993 httpd: mod_http2 concurrent pool usage

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Apache project for reporting this issue.
